required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 1 Study to Evaluate the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of Entecavir Extended Release (XR) in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Partially-Blind, Parallel-Group, Active and Placebo Controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of Single Oral Doses of Entecavir Extended Release (XR) in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a phase 1, randomized, parallel-group, single-center study in healthy adult subjects. The study will be conducted in two parts sequentially:
Part 1 is an open-label, two-arm, active-controlled design to evaluate the PK and safety of single oral dose of ETV XR tablet (1.5 mg) in healthy subjects. Part 1 will consist of 16 healthy subjects.
Part 2 is a double-blind, three-arm, placebo-controlled design to evaluate the PK and safety of higher oral doses of ETV XR tablet (3 mg and 6 mg) in healthy subjects. Part 2 will consist of 24 healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: To characterize the Pharmacokinetics (PK) of ETV XR tablet after single oral doses in healthy subjects.
To characterize the Pharmacokinetics (PK) of ETV XR tablet after single oral doses
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC)

primary_outcome.measure: To characterize the Pharmacokinetics (PK) of ETV XR tablet after single oral doses

To characterize the Pharmacokinetics (PK) of ETV XR tablet after single oral doses

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess ETV XR tablet in healthy subjects.
To assess ETV XR tablet in healthy subjects.
To assess ETV XR tablet in healthy subjects.
To assess ETV XR tablet in healthy subjects.
To evaluate the dose linearity of ETV XR tablet

intervention.description: Study drug (entecavir or placebo) will be administered with 240 mL of water following an overnight fast (no food or drink, except water, for at least 10 hours). Subjects will be required to fast (no food or beverages other than water) until after collection of the 4-hour blood draw.
